page.title: 05THE READING ROOM IN YANWORTH
page.content: { About 1900 Lord Eldon had built a {Reading Room as an early working men's {club. }One of Yanworth's oldest men recalls how from six to nine at night men over 20 could enjoy the daily newspaper, dominoes, bagatelle etc. Usually no children were allowed and then only with their fathers. Women were only admitted to hear the local M.P. at General Election meetings. In 1938 Lord Vestey restored and enlarged the building in commemoration of George V1's coronation. Changing attitudes and interests saw the building used for village dances and concerts. For a time there was a small band and choir of local people. A shepherd's son is remembered for his violin playing. Recently there has been a further extension and outside a barbecue built to cater for modern tastes.
